author: sfgate.com
title: Daily Briefing, Oct. 14
text:
D’oh!
Of all the uses for Periscope, this was not one we envisioned: Police in Lakeland, Fla., said a 23-year-old woman there recorded and broadcast her Saturday night drunken-driving trip using the Periscope app. The woman apparently kept repeating that she was drunk as she drove, and started receiving messages from friends watching to stop before she hurt herself. “After 30 years of law enforcement I hadn’t seen anything like this before,” Lakeland police spokesman Sgt. Gary Gross told Tampa Bay’s 10News. “I got to tell you I was a little shocked.”
Hot now
Facebook said Tuesday it will test a version of its news feed that lets users see only video. It’s a filter of sorts, “a place on Facebook for people to go when they exclusively want to watch video — whether that’s videos they’ve saved for later, or videos from friends, Pages they follow, and other video publishers on Facebook,” according to a company blog post. The filter will appear as a tab at the bottom of the screen.
Getting it together
Wells Fargo & Co. Tuesday agreed to buy $32 billion in assets from General Electric Co. and take on about 3,000 employees, according to Bloomberg. The sale includes commercial-distribution and vendor-finance units, and a portion of the corporate-finance business, from GE Capital. Page C5 .
The Daily Briefing is compiled from San Francisco Chronicle staff and news services. See more items and links at www.sfgate.com . Twitter: @techchronicle
